ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: Grants from, and contracts with Federal Departments
Grants from, and contracts with New Brunswick provincial departments and agencies including CFI matching grants.
Grants from, and contracts with NB Municipal departments
Grants from, and contracts with, provinces other than New Brunswick
Grants from, and contracts with US and other foreign governments.
Includes credit and non credit course tuition and other student related fees.
Grants from, and contracts with corporations, business enterprises, not for profits, foundations. Contributions that fall outside of donations receipted to 45200 also included here.
Ancillary related revenues; residence, youth camps, IBME, Conference Services

If the University is ultimately responsible for 100% of the cost but managed to offset the costs through partial or total recovery, then an external cost recovery object is appropriate. A contribution agreement may exist.

Payments to full and part time staff who hold an academic rank and are engaged in instruction and research activities. E.g. Deans, professors, lecturers. Leaves such as administrative, academic or sabbatical also included.

Payments to full and part time staff and non-staff members without academic rank but who are engaged in instruction and research activities. E.g. instructors, tutors, markers, lab, teaching, research, clinical assistants. Post doctoral fellows and others. Payments to graduate and undergraduate students undertaking instruction and research activities also included.

Payments to those not reported in 51xxx. Payments to full time and part time non instructional support staff, technicians, teaching and research lab technicians, clerical, secretarial, professional and managerial, janitorial, trades and maintenance. Also includes individuals who hold an academic rank, but are engaged in activities other than instruction and research such as President, Vice-Presidents, certain librarians and computing center personnel.
For expenses that meet the definition and thresholds for capital assets.
Travel includes expenditures on recruitment, travel, moving and relocation of staff, field trips and all other types of travel necessary for the operation of the university.
Includes the purchases of and access to books, periodicals, and other reference materials for the universities main, faculty or departmental libraries. Book binding also included.
Hospitality, advertising, misc. licenses, bank charges
Include expenditures that would normally be consumed in the fiscal year. Small dollar equipment and computer software should be reported under 64xxx F&E.
Furniture and Equipment purchases. If the cost exceeds $15,000 it may be classified as a capital asset and recorded in object codes beginning with 60xxx.
Equipment rental, maintenance contracts, leases and site licenses

Repairs and maintenance of the existing space of the institution. If the renovation exceeds $100k and extends the life of the building use 60240. For repairs and maintenance of detached equipment use 64210.

Fees paid for specialized service contracted out to external agencies (includes both time and material) use 75xxx. For contracted services related to renovations and alterations use 72xxx, for professional fees use 76xxx, for equipment rental and maintenance use 64xxx, land & buildings use 72xxx.

Expenditures for professional fees normally performed by those requiring a professional license (auditors, lawyers, doctors, engineers, human resource, and other consultants). Services are commonly advisory based on their area of professional expertise.
Insurance costs of the university
Property tax of the university
Membership costs of the university
Cost of goods sold is to be used where an inventory method of accounting is normally used.
Interest and service debts of the institution, E.g. bank interest, mortgages.
Centralized departments use internal cost recoveries to allocate costs across the institution. Both sides of the entry must use the same object.
Carry forwards/Internally restricted net assets

Interfund transfers (94xxx) are the movement of cash/fund balance from one fund to another. If the transfer relates to transferring goods or services then use ICR (91xxx) or the exact revenue or expense object on both sides. Transfers are not permitted between all fund combinations. Transfers require 94xxx object for both sides of the entry.
